text_blocks.text: འབྲུག་གི་ཆུའི་བཅའ་ཁྲིམས་ ༢༠༡༡ ཅན་མ།
The Water Act of Bhutan 2011
མཆོད་བརྗོད།
ཕྱོགས་བཅུའི་རྒྱལ་བ་ཀུན་འདུས་པད་མ་འབྱུང་། ། འབྲུག་གི་ལྷ་སྐལ་བྱོན་པ་མཐུ་ཆེན་རྗེ། ། རྗེ་འབངས་བུ་བཞིན་སྐྱོང་བའི་གེ་སར་མཆོག། ། དྲིན་ཅན་གོང་མ་རྣམས་ལ་གུས་ཕྱག་འཚལ། །
འཛམ་གླིང་ཡངས་པའི་རྒྱུ་ནོར་ཀུན་གྱི་གཙོ། ། གངས་ཆུ་གཙང་ཆུ་སྨན་ཆུ་ཨུམ་ཆུ་སོགས། ། མཁའ་ཁྱབ་འགྲོ་ཀུན་འཚོ་བའི་བདུད་རྩི་དངོས། ། ཆུ་ཟད་མི་བྱ་སྤཡོད་ལམ་མཁས་པར་མཛོད། །
རྒྱལ་ཁབ་གོང་དུ་འཕེལ་བའི་འགྲོས་དང་བསྟུན། ། མི་འབོར་ཡར་འཕར་རིམ་བཞིན་འཕེལ་བ་དང་། ། བྱ་བ་གྲངས་ཀྱིས་མི་ཆོད་སྣ་ཚོགས་སྣང་། ། དེ་བཞིན་ཆུའི་དགོས་མཁོ་ཇེ་མང་འགྱུར། །
ཆུའི་བཅའ་ཁྲིམས་ལམ་སྟོན་བཟང་པོ་འདིས། ། འབྲུག་མི་ཡོངས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུད་ལ་ཕན་བཏག་ནས། ། མ་བསྐུལ་རང་གི་བྱ་ཤེས་མཁས་ལ་འགྱུར། ། བཅའ་ཁྲིམས་དོན་སྨིན་ཅན་དུ་འགྱུར་བར་སྨོན། །

Preamble
Recognizing that water is one of the most important natural re
sources of the Kingdom;
Acknowledging water resource as a State property and the State’s rights over mineral resources, rivers, lakes and forests are en
shrined in the Constitution of the Kingdom of Bhutan;
Recognizing the seasonal and local scarcity of water for drinking and agricultural purposes, despite the country being endowed with abundant water resources;
Being mindful that rapid socio-economic development results in increasing pressure on the environment including water re
sources;
Recognizing the threat from climate change in addition to in
creasing anthropogenic threats on water resources and water
shed conservation even with the existing policy of sustainable management of natural resources;

Being determined to protect the environment and human health through integrated water resources management in pursuit of Gross National Happiness and the age old tradition of living in harmony with nature;
Bearing in mind that every Bhutanese have assured access to ad-equate, safe and affordable water to enhance the quality of lives;
And realizing the need for a comprehensive legislation, which shall also foster institutional linkages to guide various water user sectors in the best interest of the nation and the people.
རྒྱལ་ཁབ་ནང་ཆུའི་ཐོན་ཁུངས་དེ་རྒྱ་ཆེཝ་སྦེ་ཡོད་རུང་ འཐུང་ནི་དང་སོ་ནམ་ཞིང་ལཱའི་དོན་ལུ་ ཆུ་དེ་ནམ་ དུས་དང་ས་གནས་ནང་དཀོན་པའི་ ངོས་འཛིན་དང་།
མི་སྡེའི་དཔལ་འབྱོར་གོང་འཕེལ་ རྒྱ་ཆེ་དྲགས་སྦེ་ འགྱོ་མི་དེ་གིས་ ཆུའི་ཐོན་ཁུངས་བརྩིས་ཏེ་ རང་ བཞིན་གནས་སྟངས་ལུ་ གནོད་ཉེན་ཡར་འཕར་འགྱོ་མི་དེ་ སེམས་ཁར་ངེས་ཐོག།

རང་བཞིན་ཐོན་ཁུངས་ཡུན་བརྟན་འཛིན་སྐྱོང་གི་འཆར་གཞི་ཡོད་རུང་ གནམ་གཤིས་འགྱུར་བགྲོད་ཀྱི་ ཉེན་ཁ་དང་ འདི་གུ་ ཆུའི་འཐོན་ཁུངས་དང་ ཆུ་རྐའི་ས་ཁོངས་ཉམས་སྲུང་ལུ་ མིའི་ལས་སྤྱོད་ལས་ བརྟེན་པའི་ཉེན་ཁ་ཡར་འཕར་ཡོད་པའི་ངོས་འཛིན་ཐོག།

ཆུའི་ཐོན་ཁུངས་ཚུ་ གཅིག་བསྒྲིལ་འཛིན་སྐྱོང་གི་སྒོ་ལས་ རྒྱལ་ཡོངས་དགའ་སྐྱིད་དཔལ་འཛོམས་ཀྱི་ དམིགས་དོན་འགྲུབ་ནི་དང་ སྔར་སྲོལ་ལྟར་ རང་བཞིན་གནས་སྟངས་དང་མཐུན་པའི་ཐོག་ལུ་གནས་ཏེ་ མཐའ་འཁོར་དང་ འགྲོ་བ་མིའི་འཕྲོད་བསྟེན་ སྲུང་སྐྱོབ་འབད་ནི།
རང་སོའི་འཚོ་བའི་སྤུས་ཚད་རྒྱ་སྐྱེད་གཏང་ནིའི་དོན་ལས་ འབྲུག་པའི་མི་སེར་ག་ར་ལུ་ ཆུ་འདི་ ལྡང་ ངེས་ཅན་དང་ གནོད་མེད་ དེ་ལས་ཟད་འགྲོ་རན་པའི་ཐོག་སྤྱོད་ཐུབ་ གཏན་གཏན་དགོཔ་འདི་སེམས་ ཁར་ངེས་ཐོག།
རྒྱལ་ཁབ་དང་མི་སེར་གྱི་མཐའ་དོན་ལུ་ ཆུ་སྤྱོད་སྡེ་ཚན་ཚུ་ལུ་ གཙུག་སྡེ་མཐུན་འབྲེལ་ཐོག་གི་ལམ་ སྟོན་ཚུ་ མཐའ་སྐྱོང་འབད་ནིའི་དོན་ལས་ ཁྲིམས་ལུགས་ཡོངས་སུ་རྫོགསཔ་ཅིག་དགོཔ་དེ་ བདེན་པར་ འཛིན་ཐོག།
Parliament of the Kingdom of Bhutan do hereby enact the Water Act of Bhutan, 2011 on 29
th
Day of the 3
rd
Month of Iron Female Rabbit Year of the Bhutanese calendar corresponding to the 31
st
Day of the May, 2011 at its 7
th
Session of the First Parliament as follows;
Chapter 1
Preliminary
Short Title, Commencement and Extent

Short Title, Commencement and Extent
* This Act shall:
<\li1>
	* Be called THE WATER ACT OF BHUTAN, 2011;
	* Come into force on the 4th day of the 5th month of Iron Female Rabbit Year of the Bhutanese calendar, corresponding to the 5th day of the 7th month of the year 2011; and
	* Extend to the whole of Bhutan.
Application

Application
* This Act shall apply to all issues related to water resources of the Kingdom.
<\li1>
Repeal

Repeal
* This Act hereby repeals the provisions of any other Acts, regulations and administrative instruments which are inconsistent with this Act.
<\li1>

འབྲུག་གི་ཆུའི་བཅའ་ཁྲིམས་ ༢༠༡༡ ཅན་མ་འདི་ གནམ་ལོ་ལྕགས་མོ་ཡོས་ལོ་ ཟླ་ ༣ པའི་ཚེས་ ༢༩ ལུའམ་ སྤྱི་ལོ་ ༢༠༡༡ ཟླ་ ༥ པའི་ཚེས་ ༣༡ ལུ་ འབྲུག་རྒྱལ་བརྒྱུད་རྒྱལ་ཁབ་ཀྱི་སྤྱི་ཚོགས་ དང་པའི་ ཚོགས་ཐེངས་ ༧ པའི་ནང་ གཤམ་གསལ་ལྟར་ཆ་འཇོག་མཛད་གྲུབ།
མཚན་གནས་དང་ ཁྱབ་ཚད་ འགོ་འཛུགས་ཚེས་གྲངས།

Community Based Water Resources Management
Communities shall participate in the integrated management of water resource pursuant to this Act, and beneficiaries and stakeholders shall be consulted in the manner set out in this Act.
Protection of Water Catchments

All persons shall cooperate in the conservation, protection and management of the water catchments areas. The right and responsibility to cooperate shall extend to all aspects of achieving the purpose of the Act.
Polluter Pays Principle
A person polluting water resources shall be responsible for the cost of containment, avoidance, abatement, mitigation, remediation, restoration and compensation for any loss, damage or injury.
User Pays Principle
A person abstracting or using water shall pay a charge as prescribed by this Act and its Regulations.

Chapter 4
Mechanisms for Implementation by Competent Authorities
Implementation Mechanisms

17.
* The Competent Authorities shall liaise with the Commission in exercising their authority under this section.
* In order to ensure coherent and effective implementation according to the principles of this Act, the Competent Authorities may issue regulations relating to water resources upon consultation with the Commission.
* Impose and collect water supply service charges, wastewater disposal service charges, and other service fees as prescribed; and
* Provide incentives for exemplary initiatives leading to inter alia sustainable use of water resources, reduction of water wastage, innovative projects, technologies and processes that support the purpose of this Act.
a) Competent Authorities shall adopt mechanisms within the scope of their authority in support of the implementation of this Act, including but not limited to mechanisms in this chapter.

Involvement of private sector and civil society organizations

The Competent Authorities may enter into contracts or other forms of arrangements with private parties, including and civil society organizations, to provide for water related infrastructure and services.
The Commission shall regulate the water pricing in keeping with section 5(c) of this Act in case of privatization of water related  infrastructure and services.
Awareness and Outreach
The Competent Authorities shall inform the public on sustainable use of water resources through education, training, awareness and outreach advocacy programs
Research Mechanisms

The Competent Authorities shall encourage or conduct research activities on water conservation, management and development, including methods to reduce water consumption and wastage and to promote sustainable water use.

Planning and Management of Water Resources
National Integrated Water Resources Management Plan

23.
* The Secretariat shall consult the public, prior to submission of a plan to the Commission for its approval.
* The Commission and the Competent Authorities shall take account of the Plan in all water related decisions.
* The Plan shall be mainstreamed into National Policies, Plans and Programmes
* The National Integrated Water Resources Management Plan developed as per section 23 (a) shall serve as a binding guideline for the preparation of plans under this section.

a) The Secretariat, with the assistance of the Competent Authorities, shall prepare and periodically update a National Integrated Water Resources Management Plan for the conservation, development and management of water resources.
River Basin Management Plans
a) The Secretariat with the assistance of River Basin Committee shall prepare, and periodically update, a River Basin Management Plan for each river basin  pursuant  to section 27 of this Act.

Minimum environmental flow requirements of watercourses

25.
* Determinations made under this section shall be notified by the Commission.
* The Secretariat shall reflect the notified minimum environmental flows in the environmental clearance.
* Without prejudice to the sub section (a), any surface collection of sand and boulders shall be operated by a State Agency.
* Existing developments at the time of commencement of this Act shall be allowed to continue, subject to such reasonable terms and conditions as the Commission may impose to safeguard the integrity of the bed and banks of watercourses and the free flow of water therein.

a) The Commission shall in collaboration with the relevant Competent Authorities set the minimum environmental flow of watercourses required to support and conserve the riverine habitats and its flora and fauna.

After having established a river basin committee, the Commission shall declare an area within which the committee will carry out its functions.
Functions of River Basin Committees
The functions of river basin committees are;

The functions of river basin committees are;
* To promote community participation in the protection, use, development, conservation, management and control of water resources in its area of operation through education and other appropriate activities;
* To prepare a River Basin Management Plan for the basin;
* To monitor and report to the Commission on the effectiveness of policies and action in achieving sustainable management of water resources in its area of operation;
* To collect, manage and share such data as are necessary to properly manage the basin in coordination with the Commission;
* To help resolve cross-sectoral and Dzongkhag trans-boundary issues relating to water resources in its area of operation; and
* To perform any such additional functions as the Commission may direct.

Prohibition to abstract or use water without Environmental Clearance
Unless this Act provides otherwise,

Unless this Act provides otherwise,
* A person shall not abstract and use water, except in accordance with Environmental Clearance issued under this Act.
* A person who violates the provision of sub-section (a) shall be guilty of an offence under this Act.
* domestic use;
* small scale drinking water supply and irrigation schemes as determined in regulation under this Act; and

Harvesting of Water Resources
The relevant Competent Authority shall facilitate harvesting of ground water, rain water, fog and any other sources to prevent local and seasonal water scarcity.

Any group of beneficiaries using a particular water source for their water supply needs may form a Water Users’ Association to maintain the water source and to manage water supply services.

General Liability
Offences and penalties not specifically covered under this Act shall be dealt in accordance to the Penal Code of Bhutan and any other applicable law in force.
Offence of felony

A person endangering a public water source resulting in an epidemic, death or serious public hazard shall be guilty of an offence of felony of first degree and shall be liable to be sentenced in accordance with Penal Code of Bhutan.

A person endangering a public water source resulting into injury to human health and damage to the environment shall be guilty of felony of second degree and shall be liable to be sentenced in accordance with Penal Code of Bhutan.

document_description:
This Act aims to ensure that the water resources of Bhutan are protected, conserved and managed in an economically efficient and environmentally sustainable manner and to establish suitable institutions for this task.

It establishes the National Environmental Authority (NEC) as the main authority responsible for the implementation of the Act and mandates the establishment of River Basin Committees. It also includes measures in case of water emergencies such as droughts and floods.
